qas.question: What is the federation of Australia?

answers.text: six separate British self-governing colonies of New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria and Western Australia formed one nation.

qas.question: What was the federal Government responsible for?
When did the colonies collectively become a part of the Commonwealth  of Australia?

answers.text: When the Constitution of Australia came into force

context: In 1901, the Federation of Australia was the process by which the <a0_0>six separate British self-governing colonies of New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria and Western Australia formed one nation.<a0_0/> They kept the systems of government that they had developed as separate colonies but also would have a federal government that was responsible for <a1_0>matters concerning the whole nation.<a1_0/> <a2_0>When the Constitution of Australia came into force<a2_0/>, the colonies collectively became states of the Commonwealth of Australia.
